item.title: Deep Learning in Astronomy
item.description: This was a self guided project. The aim was to understand the basics of deep learning techniques by using TensorFlow. Here a simple neural network is implemented to find whether a galaxy is spiral or elliptical based on photometric data or images obtained from SDSS. The data was provided by Ashish Mahabal during the 7BISS (2020) summer school.

item.title: Quantum Key Distribution- BB84 & E91 Protocol
item.description: We a team of two, demonstrated the working of the BB84 and E91 QKD protocol on a IBM quantum computer. We also looked into the transmission of the qubits with and without repeaters to illustrate the working of a quantum network. Guide: Prof. Fred Jendrzejewski, University of Heidelberg, Germany

item.title: Study of LMXB system 4U 1702-429 using Astrosats X-Ray data
item.description:
The study of thermonuclear (Type-I) X-ray burst from 4U 1702-429, a low mass X-ray binary (LMXB), using ASTROSAT’s Large Area X-ray Proportional Counter (LAPXC) data. This explores the timing and spectral aspects of the data.

Guide: Prof. Sudip Bhattacharyya, TIFR, Mumbai and Navin Sridhar, University of Columbia, New York, USA

item.title: CPT synthesis of layered BiOI nanodiscs and its photocatalytic applications
item.description:
We, a group of two, synthesized Bismuth Oxyiodide (BiOI) nanodiscs using co-precipitative (CPT) method and intern used X-ray diffraction (XRD) and Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) to confirm its formation. We also tried to experiment with its photocatalytic properties.

Guide: Prof. Sambhaji Warule, Nowrosjee Wadia College, Pune

item.title: Photometric Calibration of UVIT
item.description:
This Bachelors project discusses the procedures to find best estimates of counts per second in the filters of UVIT, an Ultraviolet Imaging Telescope onboard the Indian space obsorvatory ASTROSAT. This is done for the calibration source HZ4 (a white dwarf) and an open cluster NGC188 at high declination. It also verifies that the process of Flat field correction (inclusive of Remainder Correction) leads to improved photometry.

Guide: Prof. Shyam Tandon, IUCAA, Pune
